post.body: yes, bringing GCal into iCal is easy, it's the reverse sync that seems tricky. will check link, thanks!
yeh, our kids tv comes almost exclusively from iplayer -- BBC make good stuff
I was considering a traquilizer gun but you're probably right...
will check it out, thx!
Godt Jul!
LOL - Okay, bottle of wine opened, one more quick meet then it's all downhill till bedtime..
must be well over 100 av's in this session. audio is a bit patchy so we'll see how it goes...
VirtualU event starts now. Right after this pesky software update that came at the very last min!
Find out more here: http://tinyurl.com/7afh3 and send me a whisper or tweet me if you go as well
It's 11:30 - 12:30 EST, and free with no reg required. Andy Steggles will talk about a whole bunch of interesting stuff
There's a (what should be) very enlightening virtual event held in a new meetings product based on the active worlds platform today
Jingtea.co.uk out of my favorite gunpowder, if i have to do xmas without tea it could get ugly here..
Deleting VW "news" spam -- if you can't even personalize ur crap, don't send it to me...
Gorgeous day, sunshine and dog eazlking
Lunch for the little W's then out with the dogs for consumption of mucky things found in ditches + stick throwing...
MacManus has a preview of the new Forterra report on VW's over webconferencing: http://tinyurl.com/6j67be
The Guild Xmas special, very cool: http://tinyurl.com/6z7tnc
Generali calculated they saved 16 tons of CO2 holding their virtual training session back in May
On with Fabio at Generali, talking opensim behind the firewall
Reading some opinion on web.alive's launch, as u can see im catchingup with missed news.. http://tinyurl.com/59fe9b
Glad to see they'll be focusing on practical examples of enterprise use rather than vendor pitches...
Link to Tony's post: http://tinyurl.com/5smy7w
Chris Sherman couldnt have chosen more wisely with putting Tony O'Driscoll at the head of the new enterprise VW event next year
Realizing that when a feed has 300+ unread items in it it's kinder to just kill it dead than let it get any worse..
Wondering if worlds.com grand scheme is to get every potential marketer, blogger and evangelist to hate them utterly...?
Merry Christmas everyone!
Wrapping a pigs ear in gold paper, seriously...
Pickled herring, rye bread and beer!
Well need to make her relax at some point...
My mum. Uk Olympic shopper has gone nuts this year on the kids, food and drink etc
Robyn is old enough this year to understand how lucky she is to do both English + Danish Xmas...
Ok, off through the cows then back to Xmas stiff with the little W's
Honoring a long standing tradition of Xmas beer and dog walking...
Out on wildmoor heath with girls. Lots of ppl. Taking their annual walk
Episode 4 of The Guild is out, I'd link to it but MS make it pretty much impossble to do..
Any recommendations for a christmas tunes internet radio station? Need to get some slade on for the kids...
Charlie and Lola is the bestest kids TV program ever...
Little W's were surprisingly good during pressie wrapping for mummy this morning. now for the tidying up....
The malden labs project sounds like a very cool mix of 2 and 3d - can't wait for a full demo..
Talking with Thom and Rupert from malden labs about their products based on project wonderland - visualizations, interfaces, geeky stuf..
